Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shivers8585
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. The bedroom was quite small and basic but it was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included and this was served in a lovely room on the 5th floor with stunning views of the city. The food served at breakfast was continental style and was lovely with a great selection. The staff were wonderful (reception staff in particular), so friendly and welcoming. The biggest downfall would be the location. There is a park around the corner from the hotel and at night a large group would congregate and also the hotel is quite a bit out of the way. Once we got the hang of the tram and metro system it was all good and we travelled around all the sights in Rome with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel. Average Location. Good Service.”
Reviews.Author: Maharsh S
Reviews.Content: It is a typical BW property. A little far away from the action but its biggest advantage is its located 100 metres away from the tram stop from where via veneto, city centre is about 10 minutes away. The rooms are small. Bathrooms very small. But that again I guess is a standard European future. Breakfast is included and is very good, situated in their restaurant which has a great view of the Vatican. Giancarlo at the reception was extremely sweet and helped us with the travel and sight seeing all across Rome. The neighborhood is quiet, but there are a couple of decent restaurants very close to the hotel. WI-FI is free and can be accessed from anywhere in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Scottishladies660
Reviews.Content: I organised a trip for six Scottish ladies and chose this hotel because of the good reviews. We were not disappointed. The rooms were spotlessly clean and very comfortable. We all enjoyed the lovely breakfast which was served on the fifth floor restaurant. The view on to the river and to St. Peter's was spectacular. We also liked being away from the very busy tourist centre and we found some good and very reasonable restaurants. We also enjoyed browsing in the local shops. It was very easy to get into the centre. Trams run to the Piazza De Popollo every few minutes and cost 1 euro. I would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “20 mins - Nice walk to the city up the river”
Reviews.Author: miffysnowy
Reviews.Content: OK yes it is a walk and it is a way from the hustle buslle, but good quality reasonable rooms. Ask for 4th floor juliet balcony, but not 413? That room was waaaayyyy smaller than other doubles, from what we saw. They would move you I guess, if you asked. They were very helpful with us and moved us at 02:00, the neighbours were extremely drunk, frankly the Police should have been called. Saying all that, I would go back definetly and recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great value - lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbJ29
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with all aspects of this hotel. Although a little way out of the centre, it is easy to reach on the tram and has the advantage of being very quiet. The room was smallish but lovely and clean with a comfortable bed and great shower - what more is needed! We took breakfast on the balcony and it was glorious in the morning sun with a view over to St Peter's.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Leah M
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff, clean rooms with beautiful views, and wonderful overall value. A little bit far from the center of town, but still a fabulous walk, or a quick cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrishDub S
Reviews.Content: What a hotel - the staff were unbelievably welcoming, friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, extremely clean (it was cleaned every day) and had a fantastic panoramic view of St Peter's and over the river (4th floor). The bathroom was quite spacious, complete with a bidet, and the shower was really powerful. There was a safe deposit box in the room as well as a free mini-bar which was restocked daily with water, juice and biscuits, as well as tea/coffee making facilities. There were even sweets left on the bed after cleaning each day! The breakfast was plentiful and delicious and, again, the 5th floor terrace had that wonderful panoramic view. The breakfast room was also open during the day and had free tea/coffee/ water & biscuits and croissants which was really welcome after a hard day's walking before heading out for the night! There was also free internet use on two computers beside the breakfast room. Some previous reviews said the hotel was a bit out of the way, but it was only 3 tram stops or a 15 minute walk to Flamino metro station and Piazza de Popolo and the main shopping area. It only took about 20 minutes in total it get to any of the major sites - we walked to the Vatican in a little over half an hour. I really can't recommend this hotel strongly enough. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mini1724
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were excellent and couldn't do enough to help. We stayed for 4 nights in September 2011. The room was a good size for a hotel room in Rome, we stopped in a different Best Western in Rome last year and this one had better sized rooms. The hotel is situated about 10-15 minutes walk from Piazza del Popolo. although this wasn't an issue especially in the evenings after eating too much pasta it was good to have a walk before bed!! Good air conditioning and double glazing which kept the traffic noise to a minimum. We had a room on the 4th floor with a lovely juliet balcony overlooking the river and rooftops. The breakfast was excellent and the terrace was lovely, there was also free tea, coffee and water plus biscuits during the day which was nice when we got in from a day's sightseeing before heading out again for the evening. Also plenty of free bottled water restocked every day in the fridge in our room. I will definitely be stopping here next time I go to Rome and would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice and friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Penny A
Reviews.Content: Greta find in Rome just north of the main historical center of town. The main issue I found with looking into hotels in Rome is an issue of poor quality or theft for very expensive prices but this was a great deal and the hotel was very clean/modern and extremely safe. The front desk staff was very helpful with dinner ideas as well and since it's more of a locals neighborhood you won't pay tourist prices and get some amazing food. You have to take one tram plus the metro a few stops to get to/from this location but still only takes about 20 mins to the olosseum and anything else so great overall. Only bad thing to say is wifi didn't work in room and only in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “It met my needs”
Reviews.Author: Simona C
Reviews.Content: It meets the basic needs when on vacation in Rome: sleep and shower. After walking for 12 hours all you need is a bed. The single room was very tiny- really meant for 1 person. Bathroom was bigger than the room itself. Internet was down for my whole stay (2 nights) because of the some wire cut during repairs. Since the problem occurred on a Friday they had to wait till Monday to try and have it fixed. The good: - terrace for breakfast has an amazing view of the river, food was quite good (pastries, good bread, salami, fresh juice, coffee great etc). - very clean - staff was quite nice and chatty esp if you speak Italian - location- initially I thought it was inconvenient, turned out to be good as hotel is close to a major tourist hub: Piazza del Popolo (get off at Flaminio station and take streetcar 2 to Piazzale Manila. Walk up the street for 2 min Conclusion: who cares about hotels when the city is unbelievable beautiful? Clean, that's all one needs. Enjoy the beauty of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, though not ideally located for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: dulin38
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a business trip. I chose this hotel for the close proximity to the Academia della Musica where I had to be for work. As I arrived quite late, I was hoping for a hotel restaurant and room service, but the room didn't even have a mini bar. There was free water, tea and coffee in the room though and the hotel staff was very helpful in pointing me toward good restaurants. In order to get into the city center you have to take the tram and the subway. Once you've figured out how to get there, it is really easy though and takes only about 20 minutes to get to all the major sights - again the friendly staff was really helpful in explaining how to get from A to B. The room was very comfortable and even had a view of St. Peter's. Breakfast was plentiful, yet not very diverse, and included in the room price. The breakfast room is on the 5th floor, again with a view of St. Peter's Cathedral. I would recommend this hotel despite being a bit far out of the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Ryan M
Reviews.Content: After doing some considerable research into hotels to stay in whilst visiting Rome for 4 nights, we decided to opt for the Hotel Astrid. I must say we were not disappointed! The hotel staff were so helpful even before we arrived in Rome with pre booking tours on our behalf and making sure our 3 rooms were all together, during our stay seeing to our every need and even down to sending me a personal email once we arrived back in the UK to thank us for our visit. The staff, especially Laura and Tiziana, were most helpful and really made our stay. Their English was perfect, they ensured our group of 6 people were taken care of in every aspect of our stay and they also helped point us in the right direction whenever we weren't sure about anything. They pre booked us a Vatican and Sistine Chapel tour for all of our group with queue jump tickets which was great. The tour company were very professional and our tour guide spoke perfect English. They also made sure we kept up with the tour as we travelled with both my elderly grandparents which I thought was very considerate. They also arranged a Colosseum tour the following day with the same tour company and queue jump tickets (which is well worth the extra money) which was excellent and again they walked at our pace due to my grandparents not being able to walk fast. The hotel itself I believe is in a very good location. It is about 100 meters from the tram line (number 2 tram) which takes you directly into Flaminio within 6 minutes. Once in Flaminio you have the option to go by bus or on the Metro which will get you pretty much anywhere in the City or you can just enjoy Flaminio which has many bars, restaurants and shops. The Spanish steps are also walking distance from here. There is also a restaurant as you come out of the hotel, turn left and is about 50 meters away which serves very good food at a good price. You can purchase a 1 day travel card from the newspaper stall by the tram line for 4 Euros per person giving you UNLIMITED public transport use up to 12am that day, so well worth it as taxis are very expensive. The rooms are very comfortable and clean, but maybe a little on the small side if your used to staying in larger hotel chain accommodation but we found it more than adequate. However when in Rome you probably wont spend to much time in the room as there is so much to see and do. The breakfast is perfect and offers a selection of cereals, breads, pastries, fruit, yogurts, cheese.......the list goes on, so more than enough to start your day before leaving the hotel. Plus the views from the 5th floor restaurant are something else with great views of The Vatican. Also another service which we thought was excellent was after 10.30am till around 11pm each day on the fifth floor (where the breakfast is served) the hotel also offers guests FREE tea, coffee, water and pastries on a self service basis. We took advantage of this service everyday once returning from the city and before venturing back out for dinner in the evenings. They even let us use the free service the evening of the day we checked out whilst we were waiting for our taxi which they didn't have to do. All in all I would say if you are looking for a clean, comfortable hotel with 5 star service but want to pay the price of a 3/4 star hotel then you won't go wrong with the Hotel Astrid. the hotel is not right in the centre of Rome but within minutes you can be with the public transport service located very near to the hotel. If this hotel was in central Rome I'm sure you would be paying 250 Euros plus per night!! When we return to Rome we will most definitely be returning to the Hotel Astrid. Thank you again for all your Hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Packman58
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple nights and really appreciated the warm welcome, clean room and hotel. The breakfast was delicious with cappicinno, deli meats and cheeses, yogurt, fruits and breads and all this down the hall from our room, fifth floor with a view of the Tiber river and St Peter's Bassilica Dome... Wow!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: emitheisa
Reviews.Content: Daniel was great at customer service. Decent location. Nice marble. Internet a bit touch and go. All TV in Italian. AC worked. Decent breakfast. Staff seemed to speak English well. A safe stay in Rome..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Close to transit”
Reviews.Author: SJRB81
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in October 2009. We booked a car that picked us up from the airport and wisked us here. It is across the street from the Tiber in what I would decribe as a residential area. It is nice and close to the street tram that will get you close to all the major attractions. We bought a 3 day pass that allowed us to get on the tram and the Metro. Beatiful view of St. Peter's from the breakfast terrace. Get e cappucino or esspresso and enjoy the warm rays of sun....don't be a jerk and demand a 'real cup of coffee!" your on vacation. enjoy. These people know how to eat and drink follow there lead....when in Rome, after all. Room was great for 2. A little noisy during the morning rush hour. Only minor complaint, is there are only 2 restaurants in walking distance. Both are great. But if you are there for a long stay find some restaurants close to the heart of Rome and eat before you return back to the Hotel. Front desk is very helpful for navigating the city and transit system. Wish our balcony wasn't under construction, but if you've been to Europe you know scafolding just a part of life. No big deal. Stay here you will enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Firebear1959
Reviews.Content: Astrid is a typical chain hotel that you will find in popular cities. The hotel is very nice, breakfast is good. IF YOU EXPECT air conditioning beware. The air conditioner in the first room we were given did not work (the widows are wired so that if they are opened, the a/c turns off automatically....ours must have had a short circuit because it only worked if the windows were open) so we had to move into another room only for the first night. The second we had to move again into a THIRD room, a little inconvenient but things happen. If you are a light sleeper ask for room facing courtyard. I would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend Astrid”
Reviews.Author: Boboka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an old beautiful building at the riverside. The distance from the city centre is not a problem, there is a tram station some five minute walk from the hotel. The tram takes you to Piazza Flaminio in another five minutes and there you have the Metro. The hotel staff was very nice and friendly. WiFi and mineral water in the room are provided free of charge The breakfast room on 5th floor is very pleasant with a view over the city On the web site www.tripadvisor.com we found 4-5 restaurants in walking distance from the hotel. The small Mama Mia, the family run La Romanina and Ettore La Scobina. The Cuccurcu on the other side of the river is also worth a visit providing you get an outdoor table. We would gladly return to Hotel Astrid. June 2011 Anders & Christina

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Alpine2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the way but if you don't mind taking the metro/tram it is a good option. The price is good for the room and the staff are very helpful. The staff highlighted all the spots they thought we would like to see on a free map and we found that really helpful when walking to different sights. The breakfast is very good and the breakfast room is lovely looking over the river. Free wifi in the room. Taking the metro/tram was easy and at 1 euro per person is the best deal in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent definately going back”
Reviews.Author: Lena00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend birthday visit whilst staying in Rome to visit my son. The hotel is in an excellent position. The rooms are clean and very nicely set out. The breakfast was very very nice and we sat on the balcony overlooking Rome. Wi fi was free and available, mini fridge stocked with bottles of water daily was free. Staff we very very nice and friendly, especially Francesca, very good value for money and would definately stay again. If you forget your toothbrush or any other holiday essentials they also provide these on asking free of charge. Cant wait to go back for another vist.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located Best Hotel in Rome, value for money”
Reviews.Author: krupanidhi_hm
Reviews.Content: .We were travelling whole day in italy from milan to florence via pisa and finally need a place close to train terminus which was comfortable to walk as well as nice room to sleep. Breakfast in the morning was very nice and the staff could co-operate well to serve / guide for the taste of spicy indian taste. Overall find it very good and like to suggest for the family / liesure travellers to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Has everything - and more!”
Reviews.Author: Loveaminibreak
Reviews.Content: From the first moment at the check-in desk, we were made to feel welcome and special by the fabulous staff who could do enough for us throughout our stay. Nothing was too much and they never stopped smiling or being totally charming and professional. The location is great - 2 minute walk to tram only 2 stops from Piazza del Poppolo and the gates to the Old City. Another 10 minute walk from there to the Spanish Steps. Spotlessly clean throughout and well-equipped rooms with tea/coffe making set, hairdryer, large flatscreen TV, hi-fi, and free minibar stocked daily with bottles of fizzy and still mineral water. If it rains, you'll be given a complimentary hotel umbrella, and you can buy your tram/train/bus tickets at the desk. The breakfast room is bright and has a great view of Rome. It is always stocked with water, coffee, tea, cookies and croissants in case you want to snack during the day and serves a very good breakfast between 7.30 and 10.00. There are excellent free computer screens with free wi-fi just outside the dining room and local papers and magazines offer a good selection of breakfast reading. This is an extremely superior 3 star hotel and would stay again in a heartbeat. The ambience is modern and elegant. Local restaurants are lovely, and if you are visiting for an event at the Stadio Flaminia, it is very close. Brava Laura and Rahesh!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful neighborhood with easy access to the center. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: AvBakenes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Astrid to attend the 6 nations rugby game at the Stadio Flaminio. The stadium was a short 5 minute walk away which was great, but the neighborhood does not offer much in the way of nightlife or atmosphere after the game. Since we arrived the night before, we didn't know that the tram next to the Stadium was only 5 minutes away from the metro and center. Once we found that out we started every day at the Caffee Stella Ruschena on the corner for an espresso and hopped the tram to the center. Another night we came back from the center by taxi which was an affordable 10 euros between 4. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Laura. They were kind enough to book our taxis and restaurants, including recommending the Parilli de Flaminio which was literally a few doors down. It was the best meal we had -- delicious, affordable, and worth a stop. In addition there is a cheese and meat shop on the way to the metro that had delicious prosciutto sliced paper thin, provolone, asiago, parmesan cheeses, fresh pasta, and plent of package snack breads like tarallini. We could easily have exceeded our luggage limit with that shop if we weren't worried about Customs. The rooms were smaller than expected, and our room was on the street side. Bonuses were the french doors with small balcony from which we could see the dome of St. Peter's and the Tiber River, and the shower. An elevator made a fourth floor room accessible and the stairs provided some easy exercise when wanted. The street side location meant a lot of traffic noise, but we enjoyed it as part of the city atmosphere. WiFi was free though very slow in the rooms. We did not try the computers available for use outside the breakfast room. Breakfast was good, with cappuccions provided on order. Only point for improvement there would be greater selection of fruits and hot items. The view from the terrace breakfast room is out over the river and lovely to look at. The hotel had a nice mix of guests from both Italy and abroad, tourists and rugby fans, young, old, though few children. All in all, we could not have been happier with the hotel as we discovered a great neighborhood and felt relaxed at the end of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money but away from the center if you have kids”
Reviews.Author: NickArt0356063
Reviews.Content: UP: clean, very good breakfast, helpful staff, bathroom renovated. DOWN: small, too small, TOO SMALL triple room (for a couple and a kid). Because of the winter, we had only 8-10 hours to go to museums and monuments. After 19:00 it was very cold and we had to go back to the hotel. That's why i will prefer to stay in the center next time. When you get out turn left, walk for 150 meters and exactly at the traffic lights wait for the tram n.2. Tickets at the kiosk before the traffic lights. It takes you to the metro station Flaminio and then you continue to where you like. It is cheaper to buy a ticket for 1 day, costs 4 euros and expires at midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Paul_&_Sanderella
Reviews.Content: Attractive price, quiet rooms, adequate breakfast, pleasant restaurants in the neighbourhood: this hotel is recommended. The location is not too bad with respect to the center and the sights, the tram ride is short and it runs very frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location, Great Prices!”
Reviews.Author: P_Aruna_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a few metres from a tram stop that takes you to Flaminio metro station. Having reached Flaminio, the world (oops! Rome) is your oyster. You can reach most landmarks easily within 10 mins. Flaminio itself is home to Villa Borghese. The Vatican City is also within easy reach! The staff was very helpful, and helped us plan our visits. We had our breakfast on the balcony, and had a great view of the river and the dome of St. Peter's Basilica. The buffet breakfast had a fair amount of variety, and made for a great start to the day! The rooms were clean, comfortable, and had good Internet connectivity. All in all, a hotel I would stay in when I am in Rome, and would certainly recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel really grew on me”
Reviews.Author: akali5on
Reviews.Content: At first, I was thinking "Whatever, it's just a clean, neutral chain hotel room." But over the course of our stay, I really started to appreciate the daily breakfast (with free cappuccinos) with a view over the city and the nice staff. While some find the location to be too far from the center, I didn't think this at all. A few blocks from the tram line with direct connection to the subway, easy walking distance to the left ventricle of the Bourgeoisie Park (near the Etruscan Museum). And the north of Rome, over Constantine's Bridge, contained some of our favorite little restaurants of the trip. Great hotel for a slightly longer stay in Rome (I think the tourist-choked Centro Storico would be a bit intense for more than a few days, personally).

Reviews.Title: “No thrills hotel, an overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: Tigrecbigrec
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in august. I understood from what I have read before that is close to city center, but is 4 tram stops away from Piazza Del Popolo (1 euro ticket, valid 75 minutes). (It is funny that the tram was often substituted with buses so you have to stoke which one is coming!) The hotel is OK, with larger rooms, but is close to a busy street and in the morning you can't sleep 'till late. Black curtains, so no light inside. At the time of our stay, heavy renovation to the next building, so from 7 o'clock lot of noise. When we arrived, we have discovered dirty towels in our room, which were eventually replaced, but is for the first time that this happened to me. Also the air conditioned can be turn on or off only from the reception, which I found to be very strange. In the rooms there was a controller, but it didn't work. We have to figure it out for ourselves, so take this into account. Also, there is no temperature control, just on and off. Very odd... The staff was helpful, gave us indications. But I wish they informed us about how things work, not to find out for ourselves (air conditioned, keycard in the room etc). With except in one morning, when they entered the room while we were inside, because we forgot to put the card in the special place and from outside it looked that there is nobody inside... It was early in the morning; they could at least knock... Well, we'll put it at funny things and hope they tell the next clients that from outside it could be seen if there's a card inserted in that special place. The breakfast was a little bit disappointing. Not many to choose from, very basic. In the first morning, at 9.30, there was virtually nothing left. The breakfast room, although it offers a great view, is very small, not proper for so many guests... Overall, a pleasant stay. No thrills... Next time I will choose a hotel in the city center, to be in walking distance of sites. If you don't mind being outside "the action", then this is an OK choice. The area is safe, we had no problem coming late at night. Rome is safer than I have read and feared.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, not ideal location”
Reviews.Author: KevandJan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I picked the hotel due it's proximty to the Auditorium as we had booked to see a concert and wanted to be within walking distance of the venue. The hotel is very nice and all the staff we had dealings with were extremely helpful, efficient and freindly. The rooms were a little small, but clean and no problem for a long weekend. Facilities were good with a nice breakfast room/bar with a view over the river. The only downside is that for general site seeing it is a little out of the way in the north of the city. It's either a tram ride, or a 15 minute walk to the nearest metro and there is very little by way of bars or restuarants nearby. Other than that, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikkaboy
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, with bus number 2 or tramway number 2d around the corner center conveniently reachable. Absolutely charming staff at the reception! Young motivated team and a very nice terrace for breakfast with splendid view. Although some rooms are very small (especially thos with french bed) they are newly furnished and very clean. Minibar filled with water for free. Absolutely recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, but too far away for tourism...”
Reviews.Author: tjcheerio
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rome four times and this one was a last minute trip on the way up from Sicily. The first room we were given was, literally, so small that we could barely walk around the bed. I asked for a new room and was given a bigger room directly next to my first room, but scaffolding covered the entire window, so it was very dark. Since I know that is just circumstantial, I will say that the hotel rooms were clean, but I was not impressed with the immediately surrounding neighborhood OR the hotel's vicinity to central Rome (especially for tourists). There was a transportation strike (as there are so often) and we were basically stuck taking a very expensive taxi ride to Rome - which took 10-15 min. The bottom line is: I would have rather spent the extra money on a hotel closer to the city center than on taxi rides getting there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service”
Reviews.Author: GregCypress
Reviews.Content: My travel agent made a reservation that we thought we were able to cancel but in the end the Hotel Astrid charged me for the entire stay when we did go to cancel 2 weeks before my arrival. I was charged for 1 week an American Express has fought this to no avail. I tried to stay there after my cancellation but they said I did not have a reservation. I would not recommend this hotel since they are unethical. I called Best Western and they said to deal with the hotel and the Hotel Astrid did not return my e-mails to try to rectify the situation. So if you need a hotel in Rome Do Not Book this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ttb02
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small but sparkling clean, quiet and comfortable. All staff were charming and helpful. Free, no hassle, internet is fast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean/Comfortable enough but not great”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaStarry
Reviews.Content: The room was clean enough over all but there was a day our towels were not replaced. Another day a used bottle of water showed up in our mini bar. The bed was pretty comfortable. The room is small but for the price that is to expected in Rome. More hooks in the bathroom and some drawers by the bed would have been some nice additional storage. The shower is really small and you have to run it at about 50% (still decent pressure) to keep it from flooding. If you can't sleep through the sounds of traffic then this place is not for you or you may want to request a room in the back. As for location, it's decent. Take the #2 bus and you're at the metro. You could walk it alright as well but it's not really close to anything. The view from the breakfast bar is very nice. Breakfast was decent but a bit limited and I felt the Americans were ignored by the staff there. I don't know what safety deposit box is mentioned on their site. There was not one in our room. For Easter they did a nice touch by putting choclate eggs on our bed. The WIFI was sometimes down and you have to enter a passcode every time. If I had it to plan over again I'd prehaps try for a place closer to a large tourist attraction. However I wouldn't have any real problems with staying at Astrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal! Value/price ratio is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: pasin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay. Not far away from Villa Borghese. I especially have to thank Laura, as she is the best person to deal all details in advance. Profesional English and brisqe answears. Breakfast is fresh and rich comparing to others. Although transfer from the airport is little bit mor expansive that taxi, which is surprising. Ask for price pack!!! They allways give you better price by direct booking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with some spots”
Reviews.Author: marco.to
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, small room but new and very clean. Receptionist and others workers arenot nice as u can expect, they alway look at u are disturbing them. Breakfast is very low, salty food are few and they do not replace it when needed, some croissant and bread. Minibar was included in my room rate (1 coke, 1 fanta, 1 fruit juice and 4 bottle of water every day) The worst thing is the parking. Do NOT USE IT!!!! let me explain: they do not have their own parking the use another one closed to the hotel (50 meters). IF you drive a big car is a problem, If you dont know exacly when you are going to use your car is a problem. IF you try to take your car at 1230 am - the parking close at 1 am- you can find the parking already closed.... last but not least IF you leave the hotel on sunday remember you have to take out the car before 10 am because the parking close at that time. so you have the room checkout at 12 but the car should leave before you..... crazy! for that kind of service you pay 40 euros a day (if you go direcly there is around 15-20)

Reviews.Title: “Nice view on the river”
Reviews.Author: joshua73
Reviews.Content: My stay in Astrid hotel was for business. I liked so much the business service they offer, Internet connection, news, renting car, etc.. The hotel is situated in a residential area near the center, in front of the Tevere river . It's inside a big palace. I appreciated so much the terrace on the top. How can you forget a similar view??? Yes I reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very big hotel, but very "well-managed"”
Reviews.Author: Roby_Mitch
Reviews.Content: We book a month before, after a prudent search.. The hotel isn't very close to the main center. You have to walk 20 minutes to reach Piazza Spagna, but anyway it's in a quite and nice discrict. The breakfst is very rich and wee-goomed. Thanks a lot to the reception staff for all informations they gave us!!! ;-) When we travel we have always many questions!!!! Room was clean and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ouintexas
Reviews.Content: It's just off the beaten path, with easy access to the train..just a few blocks away...this takes you to the subway. The staff was very kind and courteous. Smaller rooms, but that's okay because you don't stay in your room very much in this city!

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: wsupilot
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel! The staff was super friendly and made the stay very enjoyable. The rooms were plenty spacious for my wife and I and the minibar’s daily replenishment at no cost was a huge treat! We stayed in August and room temperature was very comfortable. Make sure you make it up to the breakfast in the morning…it’s a delicious way to start your day! Our only tip…we had read here on tripadvisor that you take the Metro to Flaminio stop and then the #2 tram for 3 stops. That is correct with the exception of the tram info. It appears the #2 tram is currently undergoing some rehabilitation so you must take the #2 bus instead of the tram. Small detail but may save you some trouble during the tram rehab. Can’t say enough good about this hotel. We hope to visit again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioning or large bed..cant have both apparently”
Reviews.Author: globetrekker1111
Reviews.Content: The actual size of the room is unbelievably small. The photo of the room is misleading. There is no walking space around the bed in actuality. There was no balcony in the room like advertised. The first night..the bathroom was set up for only one person although I booked a double room. The temperature in Rome all three nights I stayed was aprox. 100 degrees and the air conditioning in the room was not working. When I called the desk, they told me I requested a large bed when I booked the hotel, and that the particular room with the large bed did not have a working air conditioner. I wish they would have mentioned this to me prior to checking me into this room..so I could have made the decision about what was "priority". The breakfast was very meager, and basically the same every single morning. (bread, boiled eggs only, jams, juice). The view from the breakfast area is not that great and very small where you can hear very clearly the conversation of the table next to yours. The lobby attendant at the end of your trip offers to watch your bags while you walk around locally waiting for your shuttle or taxi. It wasn't until I sat inside the plane did I notice that my iphone was missing from my bag. I had it inside the room prior to leaving and went straight from hotel to airport...

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: klworrell
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16 year old daughter & I just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. It was our first time in Rome and we really enjoyed our stay at the Astrid. We were greeted very cordially at check in and provided with wonderful directions and suggestions for Rome sightseeing. We arrived at around 10 AM and our room was ready and we were allowed to check in right away. The trams were very easy & handy to use. We liked being a little away from the center. We ended up going to the Vatican 3 times (picked up tickets for Easter Mass, attended Easter Mass & visited the Vatican Museums) and found the tram line to be very convenient. The hotel even sold transit tickets, which was very convenient. Breakfast was great and the staff were always very friendly. They even gave our daughter a Kinder Sorpresa big Easter egg on Easter morning. The breakfast room was very pleasant and bright, also. The free water and other soft drinks were the icing on the cake, though the refrigerator in our room did not work well. Our room faced the inner courtyard, so noise was not a problem. My husband was able to use the free internet service on his laptop in our room. We ate at the nearest restaurant on our last night and found it to be very good also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ihearteurope09
Reviews.Content: Why you should stay at Hotel Astrid: -Great staff. Friendly faces at reception and in the morning during breakfast. It was nice to come back to the hotel after a day of experiencing surly attitudes from waiters and other people in Rome. -Free internet access -Wide selection at breakfast buffet -Clean rooms -Complimentary bottled water/juices -Spacious and clean bathrooms

Reviews.Title: “Staff and Service Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nikitaandduker
Reviews.Content: Staff amazing, Great gem right along the Tiber River, so you can't get lost!! The 5th floor - Breakfast room and great views of the Tiber and St. Peters Dome. A short walk to public transit! Here's something that does not happen at the majority of hotels. We had booked an all day trip to the Isle of Capri and were being picked up at the hotel at 6:30 am. We were going to miss breakfast. As we were standing outside waiting for our bus the gentleman at the front desk comes out to us with a breakfast to go!! Room small but no issue with that! Beautiful location, Roof Top Terrace was great used it every moring for breakfast - except one and at night to sit outside and watch Rome go by! We walked from St Peters back one day - great walk!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanCB
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel, in nice quiet area of Rome. The Room was a good size and the breakfast good value with stunning views from the terrace where the breakfast is served. The only disappointment was that the bar was not open at night as there isn't much nightlife round about but there a few good restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: noplacelikemyhome
Reviews.Content: What a great place. Our room was lovely, very clean and the added bonus of complementary water in the room was just a great bonus. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was great. We couldn't figure out the tram/bus schedule (our fault), and it was a walk to the metro but we always felt safe and had no problems. The great thing about this place was the location. We drove in from the north and found our way right to this hotel without having to drive through the heart of Rome. I can't tell you how many gray hairs that saved me! Plus there was a parking garage affiliated with the hotel, so we could just leave our car there for the three nights and not worry about it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on outskirts of city”
Reviews.Author: Familyman087
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed a long weekend in Rome, staying at Hotel Astrid. We had a very pleasant stay - everything was spotlessly clean and comfortable, our rooms were on the top floor and were therefore quiet at night. The highlights were the lovely breakfast taken on the open terrace with great views and the exceptionally friendly and helpful receptionist, who was happy to book us in for meals at local restaurants, order taxis when required and sell us tram tickets, all with a smile! Only disappointment was that the roof terrace was not open in the evening for drinks as we expected. If we return to Rome, we would prefer to stay in the city centre next time - however that is in no way a reflection on Hotel Astrid. We knew from their website that it was on the outskirts but we did find the travelling a little tedious in very hot temperatures! Don't bother with metro and tram to reach hotel from the station terminus - just hop in a taxi, it isn't worth the hassle! Lovely hotel if you dont mind using trams, taxis or walking a long way!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: aot
Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights at the Astrid while seeing Rome sights. We flew in to Fiumicino where we had arranged a car service that took us straight to the hotel. It took about a half an hour in a late night traffic. On our way back we used tram-metro-train combination which worked just find with not a lot walking required. Astrid is three tram stops from Piazza del Popolo in a quiet residential neighborhood. The distance is definitely within walking distance but the heat may direct you to use tram. Within a block there are several restaurants that do not have a touristy feeling meaning the food is good, moderately priced served with friendly service. Also the small grocery store on your way to tram stop has very attractive prices for instance for water bottles. The room was decent in size, two people could open their luggage without too much problems. Air conditioning has controls in the room and is very efficient. Our room had a view of the Tiber river. In the rooms there are is a free minibar with soda, water and juice. Also free wireless internet connection is available by asking for username and password from front desk. The staff all around was very helpful and especially the cleaning service was of very high standard. The included breakfast is served on a very nice terrace and consists of pastries, bread, cereal, yogurt, juice and coffee/tea. The staff makes a very nice cappuccino on request. Overall I would recommend the hotel if you are willing to walk or use the tram to reach it. Everything in the hotel was what I expect from a three star hotel and I quite enjoyed the quiet area and the nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: exp-travel
Reviews.Content: It is a decent hotel. It's slightly away from the center of Rome, but is easily accessible via the tram. The rooms were clean and fairly spacious. Also, there's a great view of Vatican city from the breakfast home.

Reviews.Title: “Group of 15 great stay”
Reviews.Author: UKBurkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night, a group of 15 on a quick trip to Rome. The staff were wonderful, always happy, smiling and full of fun. They gave advice freely and arranged a lunch for us all at a nearby restaurant. The rooms were small but perfectly adequate, nice bathrooms, good air conditioning. It's a ten minute cab ride from town costing between 7-10 euro a trip, reception will phone for a cab for you. The breakfast is great, it is taken on a terrace room on the upper floor. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sophie40
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel, rooms were small but clean and room service cleaned everyday, topping up the free minibar - no alcohol!! and left us sweets! The rooftop terrace was great for pre dinner cocktails and a nightcap. Staff were great, very helpful and reccommended a good traditional roma restaurant just round the corner where we enjoyed dinner on our first night. Hotel not very conveniently located, but not that far from central rome once you get familar with the trams and as its located on overlooking the Tiber is possible to walk on a sunny day. Will stay in a more central location on our next visit, but would stay here again. Tip. Check out opening times of Sistine Chapel as it was closed when we got there on Saturday afternoon at 3pm!! and it closes on Sundays in February!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: joeyankee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here four nights. Out of four hotels in Europe this one was the only disappointment. The staff was very nice and helpful w/ any questions. The location was a bit out of the way. We ate at a nice Trattoria a block from the hotel the night we got there. We walked along the river the first day, but my wife felt a little unsafe so from there on we took taxis. Our dislike of the location might have more to say about Rome itself. Sure the areas where there are tourists are very nice and you feel safe. But the areas like around the hotel were poorly lit at night, there seemed to be no one outside, parks and landscaping were overgrown, and there is tons of graffiti. The area just had an eerie feeling about it. Our room: I’m not sure who the designer was, but I think the theme of the décor was “European grandma’s smoky retreat”. Being non-smokers it’s such a drag to be in a room that reeks of smoke. Also smoke was coming into our room from the room below. I know it’s the European way to have the electricity off when you’re out of the room, but it would have been nice to come back to a cool room after walking in the heat all day. The “double” bed it made up of two smaller beds that sink in the middle so it wasn’t too comfortable. The view of the inner courtyard wasn’t too appealing either. Those are my only complaints. I realize it could have been a lot worse. Overall there just was no upside to this hotel. The common Areas were very nice w/ marble throughout. The website is very nice and you do get free continental breakfast (try the coffee;) and minibar (not your typical minibar). But I would give all that up for a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service / Good location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingTaxman
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the third stop of long trip to New York, Rome, Tunisia and back to Rome. The location is pretty good for a young couple. The neighborhood seemed safe and has a few restaurants and "mercados" where you can buy your own proschiuto and other Italian delicacies. Its a two minute walk to the Tramway which takes another five to ten minutes to reach Piazza del Poppolo. From there, the subway or your feet will take you just about anywhere. Its a nice walk from Piazza del Poppolo through the fancy shopping district to the Spanish steps. I have to say that this hotel was reccommended to me by a friend who lives in Rome and he went personnally to book it for me, so maybe I got extra special attention, but the service was outstanding, they helped us with everything and gave us a "huge" room by their standards (still small by North American standards...). Everything was nice and clean, though not necessarily new. The breakfast terrace is a big plus, with an awesome view and a good variety. On our final night, we had already checked out but they kindly let us make our own dinner on the terrace with Bread, Proschiuto and Cheeses we had bought around the corner. Add a nice sunset and some Pinot Grigio and we had our best meal in Rome, for about 20euros!!! Rome is an expensive city for hotels and I think this one delivers great value at 137euros/night (on the same trip, I stayed at the prestigious Grand Hotel de la Minerve for two nights at 285Euros/night and didn't feel I got my money's worth.)

Reviews.Title: “Highjly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Astrid. The rooms were nice and clean. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast was outstanding. Some comment on the distance to the main part of Rome. We didn't find this to be an issue. The trolley comes close to the hotel every few minutes and once on you were at the metro stop within 5-10 minutes. We could get to the Vatican or the Coliseum within 20-25 minutes from leaving our room. I highly recommend getting the daily or weekly metro pass which makes getting around very easy. I would also note that the hotel is in a nice residential neighborhood close to the river. There were some nice shops, particularly a nice local grocery where we talked with the owner every day about the World Cup and a local pizzaria. For the price, we were very pleased with the Astrid and would go back and send family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but a trek into town”
Reviews.Author: LondonCG
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a group of six, including parents. The hotel itself is OK - rooms were rather small and ours had peeling wallpaper on the walls and ceiling but it did seem very clean if a little more down at heel from what I'd expected. The chap on the front desk was extremely helpful and the breakfast - and the terrace - is definitely a bonus. We did find a couple of nice little restaurants nearby but the main disadvantage was the journey into town. I've always stayed in central Rome before and it does save a certain amount of hassle when you're not having to bother with multiple forms of public transport to go out every morning and taxis, etc. of an evening. Certainly, negotiating trams, metros and buses isn't for everyone on a short city break and bearing in mind some tired members in our group, also proved quite a drag, especially at the end of a day's sightseeing. Luckily we had a good smattering of italian between us and that was certainly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a three room booking at the hotel. We requested rooms with a view of the Tiber and St Peters and all met our requirements. Unfortunately, there was quite a lot of traffic noise and since my wife and I are light sleepers we asked to move to an inside room after the first night. The staff were very helpful and arranged this without difficulty. Thereafter our stay was excellent. The rooms are very clean, if a little small. The breakfast terrace is a delight. Breakfast is very good and on an eat as much as you like basis. The location is a little way out of town but not a problem as there is a tram every 3 minutes to Flaminio from the stop about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. From there you can catch the limited Rome Metro to all the destinations it covers. The hotel is not in a great area for restaurants so you almost invariably have to go into town to eat. We did not find this a problem. We had a great stay at this hotel and would certainly recommend it to others. It is a very comfortable hotel and good value for the modest room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good rates, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheridansb
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, good location. Rooms were a little small, but very clean. Good breakfast and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and Great value”
Reviews.Author: hazey
Reviews.Content: First of all our room: We payed 80 Euros per night for a double room which included secure parking, breakfast, Air Con, free mini bar, CD player, DVD, Tea and Coffee etc. We were on the fourth floor and the room had doors which opened up to a lovely view (we could just see St. Peters Dome) The room was clean and tidy with a nice bathroom. Breakfast: Breakfast was lovely, made extra special by a fantastic sunny terrace and balconies with views over the River Tiber and St. Peters. There was a selection of pastries and cakes, cereals, toast and jams, fresh fruit, cheeses and sausages, juice and coffee with an extra chioce of coffees and juices if requested. Location: We stayed here because of the parking so we were expecting to be a little way off the centre of Rome. But if you dont mind walking it wasn't too far at all -just a nice stroll along the river. It took roughly a 15 minute walk to Piazza Del Popolo and a further 10 minutes to the Spanish steps. 45 minutes walking along the river took us to the Vatican - although we did opt for the long and scenic route! A taxi was great in the evening and cost only 5 Euros from Piazza Navona back to our hotel. Although be mindful if you book a taxi from the hotel as we did, apparently they start the meter on their way to collect you, so it was already at 5 Euros when we got in. A little noisy at night but to be expected. Overall this is a lovely hotel with helpful, friendly, and mostly English speaking staff. We found it to be great value and would highly recommend this hotel. I myself would stay here again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome in July 2005, with my youngest daughter and some family members from Scotland. First time in Italy and we had a wonderful time. Our room was nice, we chose one with a shower. We decided to change to one with a bath, as these are much bigger and still have a shower - highly recommended. This was not a problem for the staff and the maids moved all our personal belongings, whilst we were sightseeing. The staff were all very pleasant, especially, Titiana - her English is very good, compared to my Italian, which is practically non-existent! Good location - 5 minutes walk to the Tram stop - purchase a 24-hour ticket - costs only 4 Euros - you can use this on the trams and underground. Just remember to watch out for pick-pockets on the underground - watch your personal belongings! The breakfast room and balcony are very nice - beautiful views over the Tiber River and distant landmarks. Very, very pleasant to sit out there in the mornings and enjoy a cafe latte. The hotel has a number of leaflets, detailing the sightseeing trips available and the staff were very helpful in organizing these for us. The tour buses collected us outside of the hotel and returned us there afterwards. Would definitely stay there again......Rome was a wonderful trip - but not long enough!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tivocao
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over New Year and I found the staff very nice and helpfull and they spoke very good english. They tryed very hard to find at nice restaurant for us on New Year eve. Just 2 min. walk from the hotel, at the Ple Manila the metro-bus leaves to the Ple Flaminio/Piazza del Popolo (takes about 10 min.) from where it is very easy to take the metro or just walk - it takes about 30 min to walk to St. Peters and it is a very nice walk along the river. The room we stayed (no. 412) in had the most wunderfull view over the river and at the top of St. Peters. The room was not so big and not all new, but very nice all in all. The breakefirst room was not so big, but the food was very nice and there where a lot of different things. I would certainly stay at this hotel again and recommmed it to others.
